intro: Ornithogalum intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate star of Bethlehem, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its erect, leafy stems and clusters of white or pale green flowers. The plant produces small, spherical berries that are typically green when mature. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Ornithogalum intermedium is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
